text: oh jesus hi everyone speak the new
french tano here the internet's busiest
music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
faux chateau tong album pele
dagiel this is the third full-length
album from paris band faux chateau
the first time i am stumbling across
their stuff they are a true
blue band and honestly first impression
i thought it was great i had to come on
here and talk about it
now to start the most prevalent musical
influence across this album
is most likely france's rich history of
chantsong
obviously this band comes more from the
new school of that though it's still not
all that hard to draw
parallels between them and old schoolers
like jacques brell for example but the
magic of faux chateau ton
in my opinion comes more from their
ability to creatively fuse that sound
with elements of art rock are pop
electronic music too
at times this lp runs almost like a
frenchy radio head crossed with lcd
sound system
not only is the band stylistically
versatile but
they seemingly have good taste in every
genre that they attempt to work into
their repertoire
working them together pretty organically
much of the time too prime examples
being the fourth track before there was
the world
which kicks off like a standard forlorn
piano ballad but eventually
shifts into these beautiful gorgeous new
agey synth layers
the second track stands out for reasons
of contrast
as well the intro is this really soft
groovy piece of rock music
with great eccentric lead vocals all of
it builds nicely over the course of
three minutes
then the track all of a sudden
transitions into this
sequence of groovy vintage beats that
sound like they're straight out of the
80s new wave movement
much of the time though on this record
these influences are coalescing quite
nicely like the opening track for
example which features
a wonderful chorus of peppy synth pop
chords psychedelic slide guitar
and vocal leads that soar with the best
indie pop hits that you could name
meanwhile ekrantotal feels like the
second coming of talking heads with its
relentless dance beats and grand vocal
harmonies hanging in the background
as well as very eccentric lead vocals
that get pretty fiery around the
midpoint
the track companion switches between the
groovy
wild loose vibe of like the velvet
undergrounds waiting for the man and the
silky elegance of a dream pop ballad on
the hook
one other thing to know about this
record is that it is
70 minutes long and believe me it is a
justified 70 minutes
in the second half of this thing we
really begin to get some lengthy jams
we have the nine minute libra which
kicks off with this intricate guitar
break
that sounds like something straight out
of a 70s prague or metal record
but then it's instantly contrasted with
these long
groovy linear meditative rock passages
that
honestly read a little bit in rainbows
to me i get that vibe even more so from
the second half of the track
lomm quivian now mind you while libra is
a long track i found
every minute of it enthralling
especially given its
intense vocal highs and just roaring
outro
cantik also has this linear swelling
cinematic and hypnotic quality to it
constantly building these synth guitar
and vocal layers with
one of the most clean colorful and
dynamic mixes i've heard this year
lesson fillet is yet another gorgeous
multi-phased
stunner as well with heavenly prague
synth leads and heavy
reverbed rock riffs and grooves the
whole track and really the back end of
this record sounds like the evolution of
a religious experience of sorts the
closing track is a reprise of many
musical and lyrical ideas from the intro
building on this description of the
world that to me
reads as i guess kind of
hopeful but also confused as to
where things are going and moving i'm
not a native french speaker obviously
but my general read of the lyrics what i
was able to
translate and interpret came off to me
as being pretty uh i guess aspirational
poetic
as well as surreal but primarily for me
personally this record
is really about the quality performances
from end to end the creative fusions of
numerous styles and genres
the fantastic and dynamic flow across
the record as well
quality colorful mixes too there were a
handful of tracks that maybe i found a
bit too underwhelming or even derivative
but that was not nearly enough to keep
me from loving this lp and it won't be
enough to keep me from remembering it
when it comes
to year-end list time feeling a strong
eight
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
